summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2012 CHEVROLET SILVERADO 1500. THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH, THE CHECK ENGINE WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED AND REDUCED ENGINE POWER MESSAGE DISPLAYED ON THE INSTRUMENT PANEL. THE VEHICLE DECELERATED INDEPENDENTLY TO 30 MPH AND FAILED TO EXCEED 30 MPH. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE BRAKES MALFUNCTIONED WHILE ATTEMPTING TO PULL OVER. THE VEHICLE WAS TURNED OFF AND RESTARTED. THE ENGINE REVVED UP AND LUNGED FORWARD WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS SHIFTED TO DRIVE. THE VEHICLE WAS SLOWLY DRIVEN TO THE RESIDENCE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE FAILURE MAY BE RELATED TO THE THROTTLE POSITION SENSOR OR THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL SENSOR. THE DEALER STEVE SMITH COUNTRY (6372 W SUNSET SPRINGDALE, AR 72762, (479)361-4654 STATED THAT THE VIN WAS NOT UNDER RECALL BUT ACKNOWLEDGED OTHER MODELS HAD THE SAME ISSUE. THE MANUFACTURER HAD NOT BEEN CONTACTED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 84,000.
